DataElement.preferredName: Person Radiation Therapy Boost Modality Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: a subdivision related to specific manner, characteristic, pattern of application of  the increased amount of the treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation as an element of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Radiation Therapy Boost Modality Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to specific manner, characteristic, pattern of application of  the increased amount of the treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation as an element of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Property.preferredName: Radiation Therapy Boost Modality Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.:Boost; increase or raise.:A specific manner, characteristic, pattern of application or the employment of, any therapeutic agent or method of treatment, especially involving the physical treatment of a condition.:Elements of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Concepts.definition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.
A specific manner, characteristic, pattern of application or the employment of, any therapeutic agent or method of treatment, especially involving the physical treatment of a condition.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

DataElementConcept.origin: RTOG CRF:Radiation Therapy Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredName: Person Radiation Therapy Boost Modality Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Type
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: a subdivision of the person's radiation therapy boost modality eligibility criteria.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An advanced form of 3-Dimensional Conformal Radiation Therapy that involves the use of varying intensities of small radiation beams to produce dosage distributions that are more precise than those possible with 3-D CRT.

Concepts.definition: An advanced form of 3-Dimensional Conformal Radiation Therapy (3D CRT) that involves the use of varying intensities of small radiation beams to produce dosage distributions that are more precise than those possible with 3D CRT.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Radiation therapy delivered to the whole volume of target tissue by a single rotation of the linear accelerator gantry.

Concepts.definition: Radiation therapy delivered to the whole volume of target tissue by a single rotation of the linear accelerator gantry.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A method of computed tomography (CT) that uses continuous rotation of the X-ray tube and continuous transport of the patient through the scanning aperture that allows the rapid acquisition of a volume of CT data.  Advantages over conventional CT include: rapid acquisition of a large volume of data within a single breath-hold, thus minimizing respiration artifact and misregistration between slices; the ability to reconstruct images retrospectively at any level within the scanned volume; optimization of intravenous contrast enhancement due to the short scan times; improved multi-planar and 3-D reconstruction; and the potential for radiation dose reduction.  Same as helical computed tomography. (British Journal of Radiology 1994 May;67(797):436-44): A type of external beam radiation therapy in which the radiation is delivered slice-by-slice, providing sequential delivery of radiation to different parts of the tumor. This method differs from other forms of radiation therapy in which the entire tumor volume is irradiated at one time.

Concepts.definition: A method of computed tomography (CT) that uses continuous rotation of the X-ray tube and continuous transport of the patient through the scanning aperture that allows the rapid acquisition of a volume of CT data.  Advantages over conventional CT include: rapid acquisition of a large volume of data within a single breath-hold, thus minimizing respiration artifact and misregistration between slices; the ability to reconstruct images retrospectively at any level within the scanned volume; optimization of intravenous contrast enhancement due to the short scan times; improved multi-planar and 3-D reconstruction; and the potential for radiation dose reduction.  Same as helical computed tomography. (British Journal of Radiology 1994 May;67(797):436-44)

A type of external beam radiation therapy in which the radiation is delivered slice-by-slice, providing sequential delivery of radiation to different parts of the tumor. This method differs from other forms of radiation therapy in which the entire tumor volume is irradiated at one time.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cause to be firmly attached; stick or hold together and resist separation.: A spanning framework used to support machinery, including that for mounting a device to be moved in a circular path.: An advanced form of 3-Dimensional Conformal Radiation Therapy that involves the use of varying intensities of small radiation beams to produce dosage distributions that are more precise than those possible with 3-D CRT.

Concepts.definition: Cause to be firmly attached; stick or hold together and resist separation.
A spanning framework used to support machinery, including that for mounting a device to be moved in a circular path.

An advanced form of 3-Dimensional Conformal Radiation Therapy (3D CRT) that involves the use of varying intensities of small radiation beams to produce dosage distributions that are more precise than those possible with 3D CRT.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A type of external beam radiation therapy using a beam of protons. It has the advantage of precisely localizing the radiation dose on the targeted tissue and avoiding damage to the healthy surrounding tissues.

Concepts.definition: A type of external beam radiation therapy using a beam of protons. It has the advantage of precisely localizing the radiation dose on the targeted tissue and avoiding damage to the healthy surrounding tissues.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueDomain.origin: RTOG CRF:Radiation Therapy Oncology Group Case Report Form

DataElement.origin: RTOG CRF:Radiation Therapy Oncology Group Case Report Form
